Authors: Johannes HÃ¶lzl

theorem nhds_list (as : list Î±) : (nhds) as = traverse (nhds) as :=
  by
  refine' nhds_mk_of_nhds _ _ _ _
  Â· intro l
    induction l
    case nil => exact le_rfl
    case
      cons a l ih =>
      suffices list.cons <$> pure a <*> pure l â‰¤ list.cons <$> (nhds) a <*> traverse (nhds) l by
        simpa only [functor_norm] using this
      exact filter.seq_mono (filter.map_mono <| pure_le_nhds a) ih
  Â· intro l s hs
    rcases(mem_traverse_iff _ _).1 hs with âŸ¨u, hu, husâŸ©
    clear as hs
    have : âˆƒ v : list (set Î±), l.forallâ‚‚ (fun a s => is_open s âˆ§ a âˆˆ s) v âˆ§ sequence v âŠ† s :=
      by
      induction hu generalizing s
      case nil hs this => exists ; simpa only [List.forallâ‚‚_nil_left_iff, exists_eq_left]
      case cons a s as ss ht h ih t hts =>
        rcases mem_nhds_iff.1 ht with âŸ¨u, hut, huâŸ©
        rcases ih (subset.refl _) with âŸ¨v, hv, hvssâŸ©
        exact âŸ¨sym.cons' u v, List.Forallâ‚‚.cons hu hv, subset.trans (Set.seq_mono (Set.image_subset _ hut) hvss) htsâŸ©
    rcases this with âŸ¨v, hv, hvsâŸ©
    refine' âŸ¨sequence v, mem_traverse _ _ _, hvs, _âŸ©
    Â· exact hv.imp fun a s âŸ¨hs, haâŸ© => is_open.mem_nhds hs ha
    Â· intro u hu
      have hu := (list.mem_traverse _ _).1 hu
      have : List.Forallâ‚‚ (fun a s => is_open s âˆ§ a âˆˆ s) u v :=
        by
        refine' List.Forallâ‚‚.flip _
        replace hv := hv.flip
        simp only [List.forallâ‚‚_and_left, flip] at hvâŠ¢
        exact âŸ¨hv.1, hu.flipâŸ©
      refine' mem_of_superset _ hvs
      exact mem_traverse _ _ (this.imp fun a s âŸ¨hs, haâŸ© => is_open.mem_nhds hs ha)
#align nhds_list nhds_list

theorem filter.tendsto.cons {Î± : Type _} {f : Î± â†’ Î²} {g : Î± â†’ list Î²} {a : _root_.filter Î±} {b : Î²} {l : list Î²}
